definition: Feast of All Souls (fifteenth day of seventh lunar month) (Buddhism)
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
Chinese Buddhist school founded on the Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra (Garland sutra)
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
